comment: This professor IN PERSON was great, CS4308 was a difficult course, but she made it easier by giving plenty of class examples and working problems out on the board. The only major complaint I have are attendance being mandatory as well as the workload was pretty unreasonable. 3 big projects and 4 assignments as well as weekly class work.

The course I am currently taking is Data Structures, 3305, online. There is a WHOLE schedule planned out and yet she doesn't follow it. She gets behind on putting out lecture videos, if Linked-List was week 3, the videos would be out in week 4. Then she does NOT respond to emails at ALL.

Posts lectures by another professor filled with audio corruption. Took down useful helper videos. Graded at a glance and nothing more. Gave immense amounts of homework. The worst professor I've ever had.

Y'all she is a gem of a professor. Way too over hated for her databases class. Go to class, take good notes. The only thing is you'll get bored very easily and sometimes she talks quietly and has a little bit of accent but this class is an easy A if you put in the work and actually care about the material

Heavy class, even heavier than it looks. Takes an ETERNITY to grade the assignments/quizzes which are written response so you have no feedback about whether what you're saying is wrong or right. The project is a lot of work and writing on really dense coding concepts. Formidable class, but not really an evil one I guess. Prof was okay but bad comms
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: This class is mainly doing projects outside of class. In lectures she covers theory and basically walks through most of the labs so you can do them class, then roughly covers the assignments (step-by-step assignment directions on D2L). The exams and quizzes are MOSTLY from the slides and easy if you study/review slides lightly after class.
Took the online AI course with her. Small workload, easy grader, and enough material posted on D2L to not rely on the textbook. Surprised to see the negative reviews.

I've taken her for two different classes now; both have been very disorganized. She takes a long time to grade assignments. The second test had several questions where the correct answer was not an option. Lectures aren't really helpful because she just reads from the slides. If you have the option to take a different professor you probably should.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: She reads off the slides a lot so if read the slides on your own time you arent missing much. The study guides aren't great. She messed up questions on the second test. Wording on the quizzes and tests can be confusing. Most recent grade posted is from February. It's the last day of April. I have no idea how I'm doing in this class right now.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Test heavy

comment:
Timeline: 
April 9: posts 3 discussions (1 due each week)
Apr 13: assigns test 2 due Apr 21 and assignment 3 due Apr 24
Apr 21: assigns test 3 due Apr 28 and assignment 4 due May 3
Also due: major group project report on May 2 and a presentation May 1-3 (no rubrics)

These make up ~60% of our final grade. Nothing more needs to be said.

Professor Abraham is relatively new and lacks experience. However, she is really willing to improve her teaching style by getting feedback from students. You can meet her if you need help and she gives clear directions to study for exams and assignments. With more experience, she is going to become a great professor.

This class is hard (distributed systems). She is new and still learning how to teach a class. It was fairly rocky. Things were not explained. She did consult the class and cares about feedback. She gives you a guide for everything that is on a test. Her questions were confusing at first. Got better later on. She's better than Bobbie and passable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Many people do not like this professor. I personally do not think she is awful. However, I do not think she is great. For parallel and distributed computing, I would choose her over Bobbie any day due to her being more willing to change her teaching style for the students to perform better. She has high expectations and is still learning.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Her tests and quizzes are so confusing, they don't even correlate to the textbook or her lectures. She gets confused with the questions she makes; doesn't grade any assignments on time and doesn't release past quizzes to see what we got wrong or see the grade in class. Not prepared to class. You're gonna have to self teach, DO NOT TAKE HER!

Reads off the slides every lecture, and doesn't know the questions for her own quizzes or exams. When asked to open past quizzes for studying she ignores everyone. Assignments and tests have no correlation.

First test consisted of questions that were the wrong answers. Instead of a curve, she did a makeup test after telling us she doesn't know what a curve is. Everyone did worse on makeup test. Few grades are in because we haven't done anything for months now. Unfortunately, it's either her or Patrick Bobbie. At least with her, you have a chance...

The only reason this is not a 1 is because, this is her first time teaching this class. The material is an absolute mess. We haven't followed the syllabus at all. Her lectures are her reading the powerpoint word for word. Not sure if she understands what she's teaching. Students are suffering because of this. Purely the department's fault. Not her.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Most of her lectures were just her reading off of the slides and the slides themselves felt a bit disorganized. Personally I felt like the course itself shouldn't really be all that hard but she makes it feel difficult. No good way to really study too aside from just reading over the material and you have only one shot at any quizzes she has.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: This was her first time teaching this class, she did not provide us a study guide at first - just powerpoints and summary points. We were given a chance to retake exam 1 cause of poor grades, did not do much better. I used the textbooks and powerpoints to study and barely skimmed past the first exam. This class is hard and feels very self taught.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy
